itemDescription: British mathematician, writer, translator and anthroposophist (1894-1963)

wikipedia_page.main: George Adams Kaufmann, also George Adams and George von Kaufmann, (8 February 1894, Maryampol, Galicia, then part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire – 30 March 1963, Edgbaston, UK) was a British mathematician, translator and anthroposophist. He travelled widely, spoke several languages and translated many of Rudolf Steiner’s lectures into English. Through his studies in theoretical physics, he contributed to the expansion and development of the natural sciences as extended by the concepts of anthroposophy.

response: * George Adams Kaufmann (1894–1963), British mathematician, translator and anthroposophist
